intro: Isnardia intermedia, commonly known as the common sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom in the spring. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, aiding in water retention. It is native to regions of Europe and Asia and is often found in dry, open habitats.
